Polarity is an odd game. In fact, I am not sure much of a game actually exists. Even the designer stated that Polarity is less of a game and more like a sculpture. So it is a sculpture where you score points.

Polarity is a dexterity game where players try to balance magnets off the opposite poles of other magnets in an attempt to get their magnet to float in the air.

The dexterity part of the game is a bit rough. Learning the trick of balancing a single magnet off another single magnet in the clear is easy enough. The same goes for balancing a single magnet off two magnets that form a tower. However, once a tower contains three or more magnets it is near impossible.

Add to that a confined play area where you will need to judge the magnetic forces of several opposing magnets and the game gets very difficult.

It certainly is a novel concept for a game and it is good fun to see magnets floating in the air for the first time.

The few components the game has are all very nice. The magnets are built well and are strong. the canvas board and bag are a good touch.

The scoring is where the game falters. Learning the scoring rules is very simple. No complex rules here. Scoring points is not difficult either. Actually, scoring is too easy. With the difficulty is placing magnets, scoring points is extremely easy.

Overall, the game is fun for first-timers and for the occasional play of a silly dexterity game.


Pros -
- Silly fun
- New and interesting design


Cons -
- Rough to learn proper magnet placing
- Which makes scoring too easy

Polarity est l’un de ces jeux qui, dans une convention ou une rencontre de joueurs, attire immanquablement une foule de spectateurs intrigués par l’objet jeu et curieux de comprendre comment ça marche. Il est vrai que, vu de l’extérieur, une partie de Polarity semble un défi aux règles de la physique newtonienne, du moins jusqu’à ce que l’on réalise que les pions sont très fortement aimantés.

Polarity est un jeu de stratégie et d’adresse pour deux joueurs dans lequel chacun à son tour doit placer sur le plateau de jeu – un tapis de toile – un pion reposant en équilibre sur le champ magnétique généré par un autre de ses pions. Cela semble d’abord impossible, mais après quelques tâtonnements, on finit par attraper le coup de main, puis par réaliser des coups de plus en plus improbables dans le chaos magnétique que devient peu à peu la surface de jeu. C’est à peu près tout, le plus gros des règles étant consacré à ce qui se passe en cas de rupture des fragiles équilibres magnétiques, de pions qui tombent à plat ou qui s’attirent trop violemment et finissent par s’empiler.
---
Polarity is one these games which, in a gaming gathering or convention, always attracts many spectators, intrigued by a strange gaming object and eager to understand how it works. From the spectator’s point of view, a game of polarity looks like a successful challenge to Newtonian physics, until you realise that all pawns are very strong magnets.

Polarity is a strategy and dexterity game for two players in which each player on turn must place a pawn on the gaming surface, a circle drawn on a white cloth. The trick is that each pawn must be balanced on the magnetic field generated by another of the player’s pawn. It seems impossible at first, but after a few turns you get the hang of it, and start to make more and more unlikely moves in the growing magnetic chaos. That’s the heart of it, and the detailed rules mostly deal with what happens when the fragile magnetic balance is broken, when a pawn falls flat on the cloth or when two or more pawns are so strongly attracted that they spontaneously form a pile.
Weight: 1.69 / 5
